::Striker::

Striker looks at the chip as Spears turns her head, his eyes 
narrowing. One of his shoulder blasters swirls around, getting a lock 
on the chip. All it would take is one shot... On low power, it could 
melt the chip without damaging Spears too much.

On the other hand, there could be a fool-proof program, that could 
deactivate the bot if the chip was destroyed. Striker sighs. One
thing 
was for sure, he was not going to kill Spears.

"Report away," he says under his breath, trying to convince himself 
that it was the chip talking, not Spears. He looks through the hole
in 
the door. There was no choice but to knock out Spears, not if the
chip 
would make her run and tell Prebon everything that was happening.

His shoulder blasters charge up again, but Striker stops himself from 
firing. He couldn't do it, he couldn't shoot Spears.

"Hey," he says, an idea occuring to him, "Can you go fetch Prebon? I 
need to speak to him."


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Spears:;
> 
> She took a few steps back from the door, just out of Striker's 
reach, 
> and turned her head and neck arond so he could view the chip.  The 
> chip's control had also put in a perservation program.  She had no 
> choice but to protect the chip that controlled her. She knew that 
she 
> couldn't help Striker, but a thought did cross her mind.  She could 
> give him one warning to him,"I will have to report your actions to 
> Master Prebon."
>  
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Striker::
> > 
> > Striker frowns, realizing that Spears wasn't going to help him 
any.
> > 
> > "Allright," he says again, starting to get a bit mad, "Can you at 
> least turn 
> > around so I can see the chip? I gotta see what it looks like."
> >

> controlling
